newsitem.title: CHINA: Price cuts slow China Marine's H1 net.
newsitem.headline: Price cuts slow China Marine's H1 net.

text.p: China Internatinnal Marine Containers (Group) Ltd reported higher first-half profits but price cuts hurt earnings growth, a company official said on Monday.
The Shenzhen-based company posted unaudited net profits of 99.76 million yuan ($12.0 million) for the January-June period against 93.87 million a year ago.

Turnover of China Marine, the country's largest container maker, expanded to 1.65 billion yuan from 1.36 billion in the same period last year, the company said in a report published in the Shenzhen-based Securities Times.
"Price cuts narrowed our profit margins," a company official told the Hong Kong-based newsletter, the China Securities Bulletin.
The company said it was forced to slash prices following a slump in the container sector in 1996.
A recovery in the market and cost cutting were likely to speed profit growth in the second half of the year, the newspapr report said.
The company did not forecast profits for the full year.
Earnings per share for the first six months of 1997 shrank to 0.382 yuan from 0.467 yuan a year ago, reflecting a three-for-10 bonus issue.
China Marine has 261.3 million shares outstanding, made up of 81.5 million B shares, 41.5 million A shares and 138.3 million state institutional shares.
